This is an [R Markdown](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com) Notebook. When you execute code within the notebook, the results appear beneath the code. 


```{r}
data(airquality)
str(airquality)


```

Add a new chunk by clicking the *Insert Chunk* button on the toolbar or by pressing *Cmd+Option+I*.

```{r}
Temperature <- airquality$Temp 
hist(Temperature)

```





```{r}
# histogram with added parameters 
hist(Temperature, main="Maximum daily temperature at La Guardia Airport", xlab="Temperature in degrees Fahrenheit", xlim=c(50,100), col="darkmagenta", freq=FALSE )
```



```{r}
h <- hist(Temperature) 
h
```




```{r}
h <- hist(Temperature,ylim=c(0,40))
text(h$mids,h$counts,labels=h$counts,adj=c(0.5, -0.5))

```



```{r}
hist(Temperature, main="Maximum daily temperature at + La Guardia Airport", lab="Temperature in degrees Fahrenheit", xlim=c(50,100), col="chocolate", border="brown", breaks=c(55,60,70,75,80,100))

```


```{r}
install.packages(MASS) 
# loading library MASS 
library(MASS) 
# Set up a side-by-side plot array 
par(mfrow = c(1,2)) 
# Create a histogram of counts with hist() 
hist(Temperature, main = "hist() plot") 
# Create a normalized histogram with truehist() 
truehist(Temperature, main = "truehist() plot")
lines(density(Temperature))

```
